report.p: For writing project three Matt wrote a cover letter to Ameresco applying for an analyst position within their project management team. His letter very clearly addresses his privious experience with the company, his reasons for being interested in the position, and his qualifications for holding the position. Overall I think that this is a very solid cover letter that could most definitely warrent a follow up interview. It is very technical in nature and gives simple logical reasons for why he would be an appropriate candidate. One thing that I think he could improve on however is his choice of language. Some of his statements can be a bit too dry, as seen in his next steps sentence. It is important to remember that although a cover letter is an introduction for why you think you should get the position, your resume will highlight many of the academic and experience related reasons for why you are qualified. I have been told by employers in the past that these letters should also be able to highlight your character and your personal interests to show them that you would fit with their company culture. Consider speaking more specifically to what you know and like about the company, rather than keeping it broad, as well as including some level of personal connection to show why you like this thing that they do or service that they provide. Also, in your writers memo you mentioned wanting to show the benfits of having a technical engineering background as a member of the management team. I think that this could be a good thing to tie your personal interests to the position. Consider adding a short second background paragraph discussing how your experience with your capstone team allowed you to learn a lot about managing a team and how that is much easier to do if you understand the technical aspects of what all of your team members are working on. For this reason you would be able to bring those valuable communication and planning skills when working with engineers and technical professionals into the management team at Ameresco. This helps wrap up your background with a tie back to the company and leaves them thinking about how awesome of an addition you would be to their management team specifically!
This is a solid cover letter; you do a nice job balancing general achievements wiht specifics that are relevant to the job at hand. See notes above for minor corrections.
